title: Particle motion - total distance from velocity

content.question: A particle travels along a straight line with velocity <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow> </msup> <mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWG2bWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp caaIZaGaamyza8aadaahaaWcbeqaa8qacqGHsislcaWG0bGaai4lai aaikdaaaGcciGGZbGaaiyAaiaac6gadaqadaWdaeaapeGaaGOmaiaa dshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaaaa@463F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> meters per second. What is the total distance, in meters, traveled by the particle during the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaaIWaGaeyizImQaamiDaiabgsMiJkaaikdaaaa@3BEF@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds?

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
